newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian inflation expectations at record low.
newsitem.headline: Australian inflation expectations at record low.

text.p: Australian consumers' inflationary expectations hit a record low of 3.2 percent in June, down from 3.4 percent in May, the Melbourne Institute said on Thursday.
The median expected rate of inflation has hovered around four percent over the past five years, but the institute said that the past seven months had seen a significant downward shift.
Over the past year, median expectations have come down 1.3 percentage points, and inflationary expectations are now at their lowest since the survey began in 1973, the institute said.
March quarter data showed that the consumer price index rose 1.3 percent over the past year.
